Agency for International Development, Development Assistance
Agency for International Development, Development Assistance

title.narrative: Protection of Loggerhead Turtles in Cabo Verde

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to implement nesting beach conservation programs on the most important loggerhead nesting beaches on the island of Sal, Cape Verde. Cape Verde loggerhead population is the third largest in the world. The intention is to prevent killing of nesting females for meat and poaching of nests throughout the nesting season on all of the important nesting beaches and to diminish light pollution impacts on hatchings on Sal beaches which are the most developed beaches throughout Cape Verde. Activities include: (1) night patrols on key nesting beaches and relocation of vulnerable nests to hatcheries; and (2) education and outreach activities with local schools, youth groups, businesses and other groups and (3) organize and host the annual meeting of the Cape Verde National Network for Marine Turtle Conservation (TAOLA).

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

title.narrative: PROTECTION OF LOGGERHEAD TURTLES IN SAL ISLAND, CABO VERDE

description.narrative: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPLEMENT NESTING BEACH CONSERVATION PROGRAMS ON THE MOST IMPORTANT LOGGERHEAD NESTING BEACHES ON THE ISLAND OF SAL. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE 1. NIGHT SURVEYS ON KEY NESTING BEACHES AND RELOCATION OF VULNERABLE NESTS TO HATCHERIES OR SAFE IN SITU SITES 2. EDUCATION AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES WITH LOCAL SCHOOLS, YOUTH, AND OTHER GROUPS AND 3. WORKING WITH LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND INSTITUTIONS TO ADDRESS LIGHT POLLUTION ISSUES AND FERAL DOGS WHICH DEPREDATE NESTS.

U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: PROTECTION OF LOGGERHEAD TURTLES IN SAL ISLAND, CABO VERDE

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to implement nesting beach conservation programs on the most important loggerhead nesting beaches on the island of Sal. Activities include: 1. night surveys on key nesting beaches and relocation of vulnerable nests to hatcheries or safe in situ sites; 2. education and outreach activities with local schools, youth, and other groups; and 3. working with local government and institutions to address light pollution issues and feral dogs which depredate nests.

title.narrative: CONTRIBUTING TO THE SURVIVAL OF THE CAPEVERDEAN LOGGERHEAD TURTLES (CARETTA CARETTA) BY SECURING PRIORITY BREEDING AREAS OF BOA VISTA

description.narrative: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROTECT NESTING LOGGERHEADS AND NESTS ON THE ISLAND OF BOA VISTA. THE RECIPIENT WILL 1. SET UP TWO FIELD CAMPS AND ONE FIELD STATION FOR PATROLS AND MONITORING OF NORTE, CANTO, BOA ESPERANCA, AQUA DOCE, , CURAL VELHO, AND SANTA MONICA BEACHES TO PROTECT NESTING LOGGERHEADS AND NESTS THROUGHOUT THE NESTING SEASON 2. CONDUCT EDUCATION OUTREACH IN LOCAL SCHOOLS, SUMMER CAMPS FOR YOUTH, BEACH CLEANUPS, AND 3. WORK ON COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES DEVELOPED IN CONSULTATION AND COORDINATION WITH NATURA 2000 AND BIOSCV. THE USFWS WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH GRANTEE IN SETTING GOALS, PRIORITIES, AND DEVELOPING BUDGETS, AND WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE AS NEEDED AND REQUESTED IN ENGAGING WITH NATIONAL GOVERNMENTAL AND OTHER INSTITUTIONS TO IMPROVE COLLABORATION AND CONSERVATION OUTCOMES. USFWS WILL ALSO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE AS NECESSARY TO ENSURE EFFECTIVE COLLABORATION AND COOPERATION BETWEEN ALL MTCA GRANT RECIPIENTS WORKING WITHIN CAPE VERDE.

The recipient will; 1. set up two field camps and one field station for patrols and monitoring of Norte, Canto, Boa Esperanca, Aqua Doce, , Cural Velho, and Santa Monica beaches to protect nesting loggerheads and nests throughout the nesting season; 2. conduct education outreach in local schools, summer camps for youth, beach cleanups, and 3. work on community development activities developed in consultation and coordination with Natura 2000 and BiosCV. The USFWS will work closely with grantee in setting goals, priorities, and developing budgets, and will provide assistance as needed and requested in engaging with National Governmental and other institutions to improve collaboration and conservation outcomes. USFWS will also provide assistance as necessary to ensure effective collaboration and cooperation between all MTCA grant recipients working within Cape Verde.

title.narrative: COMMUNITY-BASED SEA TURTLE CONSERVATION ON MAIO ISLAND, CAPE VERDE

description.narrative: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPLEMENT NESTING BEACH CONSERVATION PROGRAMS FOR THE LOGGERHEAD ON THE ISLAND OF MAIO. MAIO HAS THE SECOND LARGEST LOGGERHEAD NESTING POPULATION IN CAPE VERDE AND IS ONE OF THE LEAST DEVELOPED ISLANDS. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE 1. COMMUNITY BASED NIGHTTIME SURVEYS THROUGHOUT THE NESTING SEASON ON THE SIX MOST IMPORTANT NESTING BEACHES 2. AN OUTREACH PROGRAM FOCUSED ON ASSISTING LOCAL FISHERMEN WITH DEVELOPING ALTERNATIVE LIVELIHOODS AND INTEGRATING THEM INTO THE CONSERVATION PROGRAM INCLUDING A GUARDIANS OF THE SEA PROGRAM AND (3) AN EXTENSIVE COMMUNITY EDUCATION OUTREACH PROGRAM TO ENGAGE THE 12 MAIN LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN SEA TURTLE CONSERVATION ISSUES AND SOLUTIONS.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: COMMUNITY-BASED SEA TURTLE CONSERVATION ON MAIO ISLAND, CAPE VERDE

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to implement nesting beach conservation programs for the loggerhead on the Island of Maio. Maio has the second-largest loggerhead nesting population in Cape Verde and is one of the least developed islands. Activities include: 1. community-based nighttime surveys throughout the nesting season on the six most important nesting beaches; 2. an outreach program focused on assisting local fishermen with developing alternative livelihoods and integrating them into the conservation program including a "Guardians of the Sea" program; and (3) an extensive community education outreach program to engage the 12 main local communities in sea turtle conservation issues and solutions.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: LOCAL COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ON LOGGERHEAD (CARETTA CARETTA) CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES IN BOA VISTA ISLAND (CABO VERDE)

description.narrative: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPLEMENT NESTING BEACH CONSERVATION PROGRAMS ON BEACHES THAT INCLUDE ABOUT 40 PERCENT OF THE LOGGERHEAD NESTING ACTIVITY ON THE ISLAND OF BOA VISTA. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE 1.ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SETTING UP TWO FIELD CAMPS TO SUPPORT DAILY PATROLS ON ERVATAO AND PORTO FERREIRA BEACHES THROUGHOUT THE NESTING SEASON THAT WILL COMPLEMENT THE NESTING BEACH COVERAGE OF THE TURTLE FOUNDATION AND ACTIVITIES OF BIOS.CV ON BOA VISTA AND 2. CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES.

title.narrative: LOCAL COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ON LOGGERHEAD (CARETTA CARETTA) CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES IN BOA VISTA ISLAND (CABO VERDE)

description.narrative: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO IMPLEMENT NESTING BEACH CONSERVATION PROGRAMS ON BEACHES THAT INCLUDE ABOUT 40 PERCENT OF THE LOGGERHEAD NESTING ACTIVITY ON THE ISLAND OF BOA VISTA. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 1.ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SETTING UP TWO FIELD CAMPS TO SUPPORT DAILY PATROLS ON ERVATAO AND PORTO FERREIRA BEACHES THROUGHOUT THE NESTING SEASON THAT WILL COMPLEMENT THE NESTING BEACH COVERAGE OF THE TURTLE FOUNDATION AND ACTIVITIES OF BIOS.CV ON BOA VISTA AND 2. CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

title.narrative: LOCAL COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT ON LOGGERHEAD (CARETTA CARETTA) CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES IN BOA VISTA ISLAND (CABO VERDE)

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to implement nesting beach conservation programs on beaches that include about 40 percent of the loggerhead nesting activity on the Island of Boa Vista. Activities include: 1.Activities include setting up two field camps to support daily patrols on Ervatao and Porto Ferreira beaches throughout the nesting season that will complement the nesting beach coverage of the Turtle Foundation and activities of BIOS.CV on Boa Vista and 2. conducting outreach and education and community development projects with local communities.

title.narrative: SECURING THE LONG-TERM FUTURE OF CABO VERDE AS A KEY BREEDING SITE FOR LOGGERHEAD TURTLES.

description.narrative: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONTINUE A LOGGERHEAD CONSERVATION PROJECT ON BOA VISTA ISLAND, ONE OF THE HIGHEST-DENSITY LOGGERHEAD NESTING BEACHES ON BOA VISTA, ACCOUNTING FOR ABOUT 25 PERCENT OF NESTING ON THE ISLAND. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE 1 SETTING UP A FIELD CAMP TO SUPPORT NIGHTLY PATROLS TO DETER POACHING AND COUNT NESTS ON JOAO BARROSA BEACH AND 2 CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ACTIVITIES WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN COORDINATION WITH THE TURTLE FOUNDATION AND NATURA 2000. THE JOAO BARROSA CAMP COMPLEMENTS NESTING BEACH CONSERVATION PROJECTS ON BOA VISTA CONDUCTED BY NATURA 2000 AND THE TURTLE FOUNDATION, WHICH TOGETHER PROTECT ABOUT 95 PERCENT OF THE SEA TURTLE NESTING ON BOA VISTA.

title.narrative: SECURING THE LONG-TERM FUTURE OF CABO VERDE AS A KEY BREEDING SITE FOR LOGGERHEAD TURTLES.

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to continue a loggerhead conservation project on Boa Vista Island, one of the highest-density loggerhead nesting beaches on Boa Vista, accounting for about 25 percent of nesting on the island. Activities include: (1) setting up a field camp to support nightly patrols to deter poaching and count nests on Joao Barrosa beach; and (2) conducting outreach and education activities with local communities in coordination with the Turtle Foundation and Natura 2000. The Joao Barrosa camp complements nesting beach conservation projects on Boa Vista conducted by Natura 2000 and the Turtle Foundation, which together protect about 95 percent of the sea turtle nesting on Boa Vista.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date
